pullRequest.body:
add the definition of `UnitInterval` as Submonoid of `Real`.

motivation: This enables the use of `prod_mem`.

suggested in #12266

nodes.body:
### PR summary [240fc93866](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17844/commits/240fc938665cd8d3c111e908e46c02808eae7f8c)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ coe_unitIntervalSubmonoid`
`+ mem_unitIntervalSubmonoid`
`+ prod_mem`
`+ unitIntervalSubmonoid`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
Does that make the full name `unitInterval.unitIntervalSubmonoid`? That seems duplicative
right, what is the naming convention? `unitInterval.submonid`?
Does it work to just change the original definition, instead of making a new one? In other words, move this change to the top of the file, replacing lines 28-29.

I tried to change the definition of `unitInterval` as a `Submonoid ℝ`.
Below there are some instance definitions and there I get
"failed to synthesize
  CompactSpace ↥I"
What should I do?
@jcommelin `unitInterval` is a reducible definition, so we reuse all instances about `Set.Icc (0 : Real) 1`. We can decide to change that, but IMHO this is out of the scope of this PR.
LGTM, but let's wait for @Ruben-VandeVelde and @jcommelin .
I removed the `awaiting-author` tag as the requested change seems unnecessary

pullRequest.title: feat(Topology/UnitInterval): add unitInterval as Submonoid

source.title: feat(Topology/UrysohnsLemma): add variations of Urysohn's lemma
